front.title: The CONNECT-IP method for proxying IP traffic

abstract.t: This draft specifies a new HTTP/3 method CONNECT-IP to proxy IP traffic. CONNECT-IP can be used to convert a QUIC stream into a tunnel or initialise an HTTP datagram flow to a forwarding proxy. Each stream or HTTP datagram flow can be used separately to establish forwarding of an IP flow to potentially different remote hosts. To request forwarding, a client connects to a proxy server by initiating a HTTP/3 connection and sends a CONNECT-IP indicating the address of the target server. The proxy server then forwards payload received on that stream or in an HTTP datagram with a certain flow ID to the target server after adding an IP header to each of the frames received.
